abstract: From the International Herald Tribune archives: The dead in Coventry are buried in a common grave in 1940.

headline: Daily Report: In Defense of the I.P.O and Taking Your Lumps
abstract: The online storage company Box took plenty of lumps from public investors. But that pain may be to the benefit of the company in the long run.

headline: Letters From the Pacific, From Pearl Harbor to Okinawa
abstract: Hundreds of letters from an Army private named Harold Grove Moss, whose tour of duty spanned Pearl Harbor to the surrender of Japan, have been transcribed and posted online by his daughter.

headline: Drone Maker Lily Announces a Product Delay and New Funding
abstract: The company says it will delay delivery of its drone, which people have paid $499 to $799 to preorder, until the summer.

headline: Introducing Gizmo
abstract: We’re excited to introduce Gizmo, a microservice toolkit for Go from The New York Times.

headline: LifeLock Agrees to Pay $100 Million Fine in Settlement With F.T.C.
abstract: The Federal Trade Commission said LifeLock, an identity protection service, failed to deliver on promises it would guard personal data and inform users when their information was breached.

headline: Daily Report: The Internet Is Full of Mean People
abstract: The Internet is full of terrorist recruiters, trolls, hackers and other ne’er-do-wells. But don’t forget the good stuff.

headline: Marissa Mayer of Yahoo Announces Birth of Twin Daughters
abstract: Ms. Mayer, Yahoo’s chief executive, delivered identical twin girls on Thursday, just hours after announcing a spinoff of the company’s core Internet business.
